Pvt  Ltd  RIL_button( "http: www medianama com      -educomp-indiacan-pearson "  "Educomp Sells Its    Stake in IndiaCan To Pearson; Selling To Consolidate" ); Education company  Educomp has sold    of its stake in IndiaCan  a vocational training business to Pearson  its JV partner in the venture   according to BSE filing  IndiaCan is a JV that was started between Educomp and Pearson in   to tap on the vocational training market in India  Educomp in its press release has stated that this move is part of their “consolidation strategy"  a third in a series of exits from non-core businesses  The company says that this stake sale has been made to avoid the need to fund losses and other capital needs of a non-core business  It is not clear if IndiaCan has been making losses that Educomp has not been able to fund  Educomp\'s Consolidation:  Educomp further plans to focus on digital content & IP offering and asset backed offerings like schools and colleges   Note that Educomp Online is Educomp\'s online education platform  It is not clear if there are other IP offerings or any in the pipeline  But it is clear that Educomp plans to keep its focus on digital  In January    Authorgen  a subsidiary of Educomp Solutions Ltd  had raised Rs   crore from Kaizen  a private equity firm and a German media company  Bertelsmann  Authorgen through its website  WizIQ com enables education service providers to create virtual classrooms and also convert document to flash  It appears that Educomp has also sold    stake in Eurokids International Ltd to a group of investors led by GPE India  last month  In    Educomp merged Studyplaces com after being acquired in     It is worth noting that Kleiner Perkins  Caulfield & Byers (KPCB)  Sherpalo Ventures and InfoEdge  all investors in Studyplaces com had reported that they lost money in the business   Educomp plans to further continue this consolidation process  Other Developments in the Education Sector Note that IndiaCan is the second acquistion for Pearson this year  In February    Pearson had acquired the remaining    stake in TutorVista thereby increasing its stake in the company to    TutorVista provides online tutoring service to students  In the same month  e-learning site MeritNationraised Rs   crore funding from Info Edge (India)  With this investment  InfoEdge became a majority stakeholder in Applect Learning Systems  the company that owns MeritNation  In March    online test platform  Rank Junction had raised undisclosed sum of money from Indian Angel Network  In the same month  Skoolshop com  an ecommerce site run by Occasion Kommerce Pvt  Ltd had raised series A funding from Blume Ventures & others  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Real Estate Emaar to end JV with Indian partner MGF Swet Sarika   words   April   VC Circle MMVVCC English Copyright    Mosaic Media Ventures Pvt  Ltd  Emaar Properties PJSC  Dubai’s biggest developer  has decided to end its  -year-old joint venture with MGF Developments Ltd in India following a year-long separation tussle between the partners  Emaar said in a statement on Wednesday it will take steps to reorganise Emaar MGF Land Ltd via a demerger to sharpen its focus on its Indian operations and develop ongoing projects  The development comes almost a year after reports first surfaced about a possible split due to disagreement between the partners but Emaar had denied any such move  The Dubai developer had brought in about Rs     crore in the joint venture and owned roughly   per cent stake along with loans and guarantees while MGF held the remaining stake  While Emaar didn’t disclose details of the demerger  media reports have suggested that the Dubai firm is likely to get a bigger share when the two partners split assets  “They were in discussion to thrash out the various issues with regard to debt and partly completed projects that were stuck due to paucity of funds  It was a complicated process as it involves many running projects and large land parcels of about     acres spread over various cities in India " The Economic Times reported citing a person familiar with the development  Emaar MGF  formed in    is known mainly for building the Commonwealth Games Village for athletes taking part in the event’s   edition in New Delhi  However  it faced massive criticism for delays and poor construction quality  It also tried to float an initial public offering but couldn’t do so after the stock markets plunged following the global economic crisis in    It made more attempts to launch an IPO in   and   but ultimately scrapped the plans  Emaar is famous for developing the world’s tallest building  the Burj Khalifa  in Dubai  Headed by chairman Mohamed Ali Rashad Alabbar  Emaar has operations in   countries in the Middle East  North Africa  Asia and Europe  MGF Development was started by Shravan Gupta in    It claims to have delivered   million square feet of retail space and is developing about   million square feet of retail space and   million square feet of residential space  Known for its retail assets at the time of forming the JV  MGF now has presence across residential  commercial and retail segments with projects in Gurgaon  Mohali  Jaipur  Indore and Hyderabad   The joint venture was formed during the heyday of real estate when huge capital flowed in  But exits have been a pain point with some markets under the grip of a slowdown  The past two years have been particularly painful for developers as tepid forced them to look for various financing options to survive   The national capital region  where the company has maximum exposure  has been worst hit by the slowdown with sales slipping significantly over the years  This has taken the unsold stock with developers to an alarming level  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  ERGO  HERO GROUP NOT TO PURSUE JOINT VENTURE (Hero Group has decided against diversification into life Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Hershey to Acquire All Outstanding Shares of the Godrej Hershey Joint Venture     words   September    :  Business Wire BWR English (c)   Business Wire  All Rights Reserved  HERSHEY  Pa --(BUSINESS WIRE)--September     -- The Hershey Company ("Hershey") (NYSE: HSY) today announced that it has reached an agreement to acquire the   percent stake in Godrej Hershey Ltd  that it does not own  primarily from Godrej Industries Ltd  ("Godrej") and another minority shareholder  Including the assumption of about      million in debt  which is already consolidated by Hershey as the majority shareholder  the company will own the Maha Lacto and Nutrine candy brands and the Jumpin and Sofit beverage brands as well as the related manufacturing facilities  The transaction is expected to close by the end of the third quarter and the new entity will transition to use the name Hershey India as it becomes a wholly owned subsidiary of The Hershey Company  As part of the transaction  the minority shareholders will receive an undisclosed cash consideration  "India is a key focus market for The Hershey Company " said J P  Bilbrey  President and Chief Executive Officer  The Hershey Company  "We have a great deal of respect for Godrej  Our partnership provided us with insights and an understanding of the consumers and customers in India  Confectionery and beverage category growth in India is solid and we\'re excited about our opportunities  We\'ll make the necessary investments in India to accelerate growth  leveraging our core strengths and business model " The transaction gives Hershey an opportunity to integrate Godrej Hershey into the company\'s global business platform and leverage corporate resources across the chocolate and sweets and refreshment strategic business units  Over time  Hershey\'s goal is to evolve into a faster growing India market leader in the food and beverage space  "With this new phase of the Hershey business in India  we aim to drive growth in this important market through product innovation  brand building and investment in our people and processes " said Matthew Lindsay  Managing Director  Hershey India  "Leveraging the learnings from our Godrej partnership and the strong management team in place  we are excited to move forward in this rapidly growing market " Lindsay concluded  For the year ended December       the Godrej Hershey joint venture had net sales of about    million  The portion of the net loss for the full year attributable to Hershey was approximately    million  When the Godrej Hershey joint venture was announced in    annual net sales were about    million  As a result of this transaction there is no change to the financial outlook provided by Hershey on July      in its second quarter earnings release  Safe Harbor Statement This release contains statements that are forward-looking  These statements are made based upon current expectations that are subject to risk and uncertainty  Because actual results may differ materially from those contained in the forward-looking statements you should not place undue reliance on the forward looking statements when deciding whether to buy  sell or hold the Company\'s securities  Factors that could cause results to differ materially include  but are not limited to: issues or concerns related to statement to actual results or changes in the Company\'s expectations  About The Hershey Company The Hershey Company (NYSE: HSY) is the largest producer of quality chocolate in North America and a global leader in chocolate and sugar confectionery  Headquartered in Hershey  Pa  The Hershey Company has operations throughout the world and approximately     employees  With revenues of more than    billion  Hershey offers confectionery products under more than   brand names  including such iconic brands as Hershey\'s  Reese\'s  Hershey\'s Kisses  Hershey\'s Bliss  Hershey\'s Special Dark  Kit Kat  Twizzlers  Jolly Rancher and Ice Breakers  Hershey also offers premium and artisan chocolate products under such brands as Scharffen Berger and Dagoba through the Artisan Confections Company  a wholly owned subsidiary  The company is focused on growing its presence in key international markets such as China and Mexico while continuing to build its competitive advantage in the United States and Canada  For more than   years  The Hershey Company has been a leader in making a positive difference in the communities where its employees live  work and do business  Corporate Social Responsibility is an integral part of the company\'s global business strategy  which includes goals and priorities focused on fair and ethical business dealings  environmental stewardship  fostering a desirable workplace for employees  and positively impacting society and local communities  Milton Hershey School  established in   by the company\'s founder and administered by Hershey Trust Company  provides a quality education  housing  and medical care at no cost to children in social and financial need  Students of Milton Hershey School are direct beneficiaries of The Hershey Company\'s success  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Hershey to Acquire All Outstanding Shares of the Godrej Hershey Joint Venture     words   September    :  Business Wire BWR English (c)   Business Wire  All Rights Reserved  HERSHEY  Pa --(BUSINESS WIRE)--September     -- The Hershey Company ("Hershey") (NYSE: HSY) today announced that it has reached an agreement to acquire the   percent stake in Godrej Hershey Ltd  that it does not own  primarily from Godrej Industries Ltd  ("Godrej") and another minority shareholder  Including the assumption of about      million in debt  which is already consolidated by Hershey as the majority shareholder  the company will own the Maha Lacto and Nutrine candy brands and the Jumpin and Sofit beverage brands as well as the related manufacturing facilities  The transaction is expected to close by the end of the third quarter and the new entity will transition to use the name Hershey India as it becomes a wholly owned subsidiary of The Hershey Company  As part of the transaction  the minority shareholders will receive an undisclosed cash consideration  "India is a key focus market for The Hershey Company " said J P  Bilbrey  President and Chief Executive Officer  The Hershey Company  "We have a great deal of respect for Godrej  Our partnership provided us with insights and an understanding of the consumers and customers in India  Confectionery and beverage category growth in India is solid and we\'re excited about our opportunities  We\'ll make the necessary investments in India to accelerate growth  leveraging our core strengths and business model " The transaction gives Hershey an opportunity to integrate Godrej Hershey into the company\'s global business platform and leverage corporate resources across the chocolate and sweets and refreshment strategic business units  Over time  Hershey\'s goal is to evolve into a faster growing India market leader in the food and beverage space  "With this new phase of the Hershey business in India  we aim to drive growth in this important market through product innovation  brand building and investment in our people and processes " said Matthew Lindsay  Managing Director  Hershey India  "Leveraging the learnings from our Godrej partnership and the strong management team in place  we are excited to move forward in this rapidly growing market " Lindsay concluded  For the year ended December       the Godrej Hershey joint venture had net sales of about    million  The portion of the net loss for the full year attributable to Hershey was approximately    million  When the Godrej Hershey joint venture was announced in    annual net sales were about    million  As a result of this transaction there is no change to the financial outlook provided by Hershey on July      in its second quarter earnings release  Safe Harbor Statement This release contains statements that are forward-looking  These statements are made based upon current expectations Full Ownership of Indian Software Company   words   March    :  JCN Newswire JAPCOR English Copyright   JCN Newswire  a division of Japan Corporate News Network K K  All rights reserved  - NEC Technologies India established - Tokyo  Mar      - (JCN Newswire) - NEC Corporation (NEC; TSE:  ) and HCL Technologies Limited (HCLT) reached an agreement for NEC to obtain full control of NEC HCL Systems Technologies (NHST)  a joint venture software company  Based on the agreement  NEC will acquire HCLT\'s    share of NHST  As a result  NHST will become a wholly owned subsidiary of NEC  The subsidiary\'s name is scheduled to become NEC Technologies India Limited in April    NHST was established in October   in order to enhance software developing resources in India  Since then  the company has developed software products for the platform business in partnership with the experience and knowledge of HCLT  The new subsidiary will play a key role in the development and system integration of NEC\'s solutions business throughout the emerging India and Asia Pacific markets  as well as Europe and the US  "NEC Technologies India will lead a global deployment of product technology and development " said Takaaki Shimizu  Senior Vice President of NEC  "The company will become an offshore software development base for systems in Asia Pacific  Europe  the US and Japan  in addition to its current software development for the platform business  Moreover  NEC will strengthen its global sales and support by leveraging the new company\'s experience and know-how in development  technology and business channels " Going forward  NEC aims to continue strengthening the global competitiveness of its products  costs  business promotions and human resources  Furthermore  NEC will create new value for customers as an IT partner that provides competitive products and support throughout the world  About NEC Corporation NEC Corporation (TSE:  ) is a leader in the integration of IT and network technologies that benefit businesses and people around the world  By providing a combination of products and solutions that cross utilize the company\'s experience and global resources  NEC\'s advanced technologies meet the complex and ever-changing needs of its customers  NEC brings more than   years of expertise in technological innovation to empower people  businesses and society  For more information  visit NEC at http: www nec com  Source: NEC Corporation Contact: Takehiko Kato NEC Corporation   - - -  E-Mail: t-kato@cj jp nec com Joseph Jasper NEC out of JV Gayatri Ramanathan feedback@livemint com livemint   words   May   Mint HNMINT English Copyright    HT Media Ltd  All Rights Reserved  Mortgage major Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) on Tuesday announced it has bought the    stake of Chubb Global Financial Services Corp  in their joint venture  HDFC Chubb General Insurance Co  for an undisclosed amount  The general insurance joint venture was set up in    An executive at HDFC  who did not wish to be named  said the book value of the equity in the joint venture was Rs  crore; that would mean the book value of Chubb’s stake is Rs  crore  Conrad D’Souza  treasurer at HDFC  said the company has applied to the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority (Irda)  the watchdog for the sector  seeking its approval for the change in the holding pattern  People close to the development at HDFC  who did not wish to be identified  said Ergo  the insurance arm of the world’s second-largest reinsurance company—Germany’s €  billion (more than Rs  lakh crore) Munich Re—is the front-runner to pick up the Chubb stake  “Till such time the Ergo deal is finalized  HDFC will hold    stake in the general insurance venture ” said one of these people  “Initial joint venture strategies did not get translated ” said D’Souza  HDFC Chubb lags behind other general insurers such as ICICI Lombard General Insurance Co  Bajaj Allianz General Insurance Co  and others in terms of premiums collected  HDFC Chubb collected premiums of Rs  crore for the year ended March    compared with Bajaj Allianz’s Rs    crore and ICICI Lombard’s Rs    crore  In fact  according to figures provided by Irda  while companies such as ICICI Lombard and Reliance General Insurance are growing at  -   HDFC Chubb was actually not growing at all  The two companies differed on strategy  with HDFC favouring an aggressive customer acquisition strategy with a range of products and Chubb preferring a more conservative approach; “Chubb’s focus and HDFC’s focus were not the same ” said the executive at HDFC  Shrirang Samant  the insurance firm’s chief executive officer  quit two weeks ago  Indian insurance law caps an overseas partner’s stake in an insurance venture at    which restricts the amount of equity a foreign partner can put into a business that is highly capital-intensive  HDFC  which also has a life insurance joint venture with the UK’s Standard Life  wants a strategic partner with experience in general insurance  said the HDFC executive  “There are people interested in partnering with us ” said the executive  D’Souza said the proposed stake sale would be finalized only after the regulator’s approval  D’Souza also said insurance firms  both international and domestic  have expressed interest in picking up the Chubb stake  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  “As of now  we will run the business as it is  Who comes in as a partner or who will be the CEO will be decided only after the regulator’s approval of the buyout ’’ D’Souza said  India has licensed   overseas and local non-life insurers as part of its plan to open the sector to expand coverage of insurance in the world’s second fastest growing major economy  The foreign investment cap of    has been an irritant for most foreign firms  which claim that this restricts their ability to invest in the business  The industry has been lobbying to raise the limit on foreign investment to    but this has met with political opposition from some quarters  Several foreign insurance firms have informal arrangements with their Indian partners to increase their stake to    should this be allowed  Reuters andGautam Chakravorthy of Bloomberg contributed to this story  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  BUSINESS & ECONOMY HDFC  Chubb to go their separate ways Nandini Goswami   words   May   DNA - Daily News & Analysis DNADAI English Copyright    Diligent Media Corporation Ltd  Local partner will buy out Canadian major\'s    stake in the JV It\'s almost official  HDFC and Chubb  financial giants in their own right who had joined hands for a general insurance venture in the country  are parting ways  HDFC has agreed to buy out the    stake held by the foreign partner in the joint venture HDFC Chubb General Insurance Company and has applied to the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority (IRDA) for requisite approvals  an HDFC official told DNA Money on Tuesday  The company will continue as HDFC Chubb till a name change comes about  for which it has to apply to the Registrar of Companies  HDFC will now hold    in the venture  though it is open to a    foreign equity participation once it finds an appropriate foreign partner  The JV currently has an equity base of Rs   crore  "All employees will continue to be a part of the same company  where HDFC will have the entire stake and we will chose someone to head the company once all this is through " the official said  Fissures in the over four-year relationship have grown since last year because of differing risk appetites of the partners  HDFC  given its size and distribution strength  was keen to move fast  However  Chubb had an overcautious approach  particularly on commercial insurance  which was proving to be a drag on the company  the official said  While all general insurance companies have grown their business  HDFC Chubb General reported a decline in business by      for  -   Its total business premium was Rs     crore  one of the lowest in the general insurance industry  Its counterparts and even later entrants have marched way ahead  even as the public sector companies with a large base have also grown at higher rates  Also  the dynamics of the Rs     crore general insurance industry has changed since the detariff regime kicked off in January this year and there was a crying need for a cohesive management structure to fight it out in the fiercely competitive market place  A formal split was thus waiting to happen  On the kind of signals the split sends out  the official said  "In fact  investors should be happy as there was a genuine concern for the company\'s falling numbers and now there is a concerted effort to grow the company  Everyone has a different way of functioning  and given the fact that all our other companies  like life insurance  asset management  bank and the BPO  are doing so well  there should not be any misconception on the break-up  which has been mutually agreed upon " the official added  So  what happens to Chubb now  Sources indicated that the global insurance giant is unlikely to discontinue insurance business in India  More so  as insurance analysts say  it would be a costly proposition to leave India at this juncture  at a time when the economy is booming  and re-entering later may see it lose two to three years straightaway  Market grapevine has it that Chubb is also scouting around for partners  This time  though  it may find some comfort with a clutch of investors instead of one single company  possibly including some high net-worth Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  individuals as well  The model could be on the lines of Metlife India  Whether it will be called \'Chubb India\' or not  though  remains to be seen  This  however  could not be confirmed  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  EIH terminates co-branding alliance with Hilton ; EIH Ltd  the flagship company of The Oberoi Group  today  BS REPORTER New Delhi   words   September   Business Standard BSTN English (c)   Business Standard Ltd  EIH Ltd  the flagship company of The Oberoi Group  today announced that it has terminated a strategic marketing and co-branding alliance with leading global hotel chain Hilton International Co  The decision will come into effect from April       Under the alliance  EIH managed and ran seven five-star hotels under the Trident Hilton brand Gurgaon  Agra  Cochin  Jaipur  Udaipur  Bhubaneshwar and Chennai  It also has a five-star deluxe property christened Hilton Towers in Mumbai  EIH will develop the Trident brand independently  All seven hotels will now be called The Trident and the deluxe property Trident Towers  "We felt there was a possibility of a dilution in the Trident brand with Hilton\'s overall development strategy in India  With Hilton planning to open the more downmarket Hilton Garden Inn in the country  we felt customers would get confused between that and the Trident Hilton " said SS Mukherji  vice-chairman  EIH  Realty firm DLF Ltd had forged a  :  joint venture with Hilton International last year  It is this joint venture company that will be setting up the Hilton Garden Inn brand  "The first Trident opened way back in   and we entered into an alliance with Hilton only in    So we have always had our own marketing set-up which only has to be revamped  The company is already marketing The Oberoi brand very successfully " said Mukherji  Over the next three years  EIH will add     rooms across three Trident Hotels in Mumbai  Bangalore and Hyderabad  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  FRONT PAGE ICI India to sell entire stake in Quest Our Bureau   words   November   Business Line (The Hindu) BSNLNE English (c)   The Hindu Business Line Nov    Paints and chemicals firm ICI India Ltd  a subsidiary of UK\'s ICI Plc  has announced its plans to sell its entire stake in its wholly owned subsidiary Quest International India Ltd (Quest India) for not less than Rs   crore to Switzerland\'s Givaudan Group  The company\'s board of directors  at its meeting on Wednesday  approved the sale of its entire stake in Quest India — its flavours and fragrances business — to Givaudan Group  for a total consideration of not less than Rs   crore  ICI India informed the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE)  The announcement followed news that ICI Plc had agreed to sell Netherlands-based Quest International B V  to Givaudan for       billion (around Rs     crore)  ICI India said in a statement that "ICI Plc has  after due evaluation  agreed to accept the offer for sale of Quest International business received by them very recently from the Givaudan Group  who has expressed interest in purchase of Quest India also  Considering the heavy linkages on the international business and the nature of the customers and the market  the board has decided to divest the company\'s entire shareholding in its subsidiary Quest lndia to the said Givaudan Group " The Indian transaction is expected to be completed before the end of the financial year  subject to the global deal happening within the same timeframe  it said  ICI India has controlling interest in Quest India  which was established in   as a joint venture between the ICI Group and Hindustan Lever Ltd (HLL)  As per the joint venture agreement  ICI India acquired HLL\'s   per cent shareholding in May this year and subsequently acquired the remaining one per cent of the share capital held by a group company of ICI Plc  Consequently  Quest India became a wholly owned subsidiary of ICI India  Quest India reported net sales of Rs   crore and a net profit of Rs     crore for the financial year ended March    The company is headquartered in Mumbai and has its manufacturing sites in Daman with about   employees on its rolls  Shares of ICI India were up seven per cent at Rs     on BSE on Wednesday  ICI has been carrying out a restructuring exercise wherein it will exit from non-core areas and focus on growing the core ones both organically and inorganically  As a step in this direction  ICI India  in June this year  announced the sale of the company\'s Uniqema business to UK-based Croda Group for around Rs   crore  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Gerdau buys partner out of Indian joint venture   words   March   Steel Business Briefing STSCNW English ©   McGraw-Hill  Inc  India’s Kalyani Group has exited its steelmaking joint venture with Gerdau with the sale of its    shareholding in the venture to the Brazilian steelmaking group  a Pune-based Kalyani Steel official confirmed to Platts Monday  The transaction was concluded in February  which was when Gerdau had announced the start of commercial production at the     metric tons year specialty steelworks at Tadipatri in southern India’s Andhra Pradesh state  Kalyani’s decision to exit the venture was owing to uncertainties in iron ore supplies in India  the official said  “We want to wait for a better situation before proceeding with expansions ” he said  adding that Kalyani’s own plant – a     mt y integrated alloy steelworks at Ginigera in Karnataka – has been operating at only    capacity for nearly a year on ore supply disruptions  Iron ore for the Tadipatri works is being sourced from the ongoing electronic auction sales in Karnataka and from elsewhere  the official added  The jv – Kalyani Gerdau Steels – was formed in   through the acquisition of the assets of the     million mt y SJK Steel Plant in Tadipatri  Each partner held a    shareholding  Last month  Gerdau revealed it had begun commercial production at the mill now comprising a     million mt y blast furnace  a  -megawatt power plant using gases from the furnace  a sintering plant  and a new     mt y rolling mill for special quality steel (SBQ) for the automobile industry  “As we begin our  th year of business  the start of the production of special steel in India represents our expansion to an important country  with an impressive cultural richness  good economic prospects and very dedicated people ” said André B  Gerdau Johannpeter  Gerdau’s CEO  For questions about editorial content  or to subscribe call    ( ) Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  L&T buys out Demag from joint venture ; After   years of joint operations  Larsen and Toubro (L&T)  NEVIN JOHN Mumbai   words   June   Business Standard BSTN   English (c)   Business Standard Ltd  After   years of joint operations  Larsen and Toubro (L&T) and Germany’s Demag Plastics Group have parted ways  The joint venture  which was set up in   for making plastics machinery  has ended after Demag’s new parent  Sumitomo  decided to go it alone in the Indian market by floating a wholly-owned subsidiary  “L&T-Demag Plastics Machinery  the Chennai-based joint venture company  will no longer be in existence as L&T has bought out its partner’s   per cent stake  Sumitomo  which acquired Demag in early-   has its own plan for India and it decided to break the relations with L&T ” said a company executive  The purchase gives L&T complete ownership of the operations in Chennai  After announcing its exit from the joint venture  Sumitomo Demag Plastics Machinery said in a statement  “As already announced in March    Sumitomo Heavy Industries is proceeding to establish a subsidiary in India ” L&T officials declined to comment on the development  In    the joint venture company had built its first factory for injection moulding machines  Three years later  it built a second factory in Chennai that doubled its production capacity to a thousand machines a year  Sumitomo Heavy Industries inherited the   per cent stake in the operation when it bought Demag in March    However  for more that   years  Sumitomo has had a technical collaboration with another Indian injection machinery maker  Windsor Machines in Mumbai  L&T had started manufacturing injection moulding machines in   in association with Demag Plastics Group  But the two formed the  :  joint venture company only after nine years  Soon after  the venture had emerged as the leading injection moulding solutions provider in India  L&T Demag launched a petition last year to the India government in which it accused Chinese rivals of dumping presses at below cost in the Indian market  The government responded earlier this year by imposing anti-dumping duties of up to   per cent on   Chinese companies  Among these  three are associated with China’s largest injection machine maker  Ningbo Haitian Plastic Machinery Group  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  ASPEN  LUPIN DISCONTINUE TB JOINT VENTURE   words   January   Daily International Pharma Alert FDAIA English Copyright (c)   Washington Business Information  Inc  South African drugmaker Aspen Pharmacare and Lupin announced they have mutually agreed not to pursue the memorandum of understanding they signed in February   for the development  manufacture and marketing of tuberculosis (TB) drugs  The companies had agreed to a  -  joint global marketing agreement  Though the companies have discontinued that agreement  they will continue to collaborate on marketing TB drugs in South Africa as per a previous agreement  At the time of the signing of the February   agreement  the companies believed that there would be strength in the combination of Lupin\'s TB and active pharmaceutical ingredient pipeline and Aspen\'s multidrug-resistant TB product line and experience with antiretroviral drugs  The companies had also planned to explore opportunities in the malaria market  Aspen is the largest generic drugmaker in the Southern Hemisphere and one of the top   generic manufacturers worldwide  according to the company  It is also Africa\'s largest pharmaceutical company  Release date: Jan       Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Emerging Business & IT Hetero Drugs buys out Lyka\'s stake in JV   words   March   The Economic Times ECTIM English (c)   The Times of India Group  All rights reserved  HYDERABAD: Hyderabad-based Hetero Drugs  makers of the Tamiflu capsules  has bought out the stake of Gujarat-based Lyka Labs in the joint venture Lyka Hetero Healthcare for a consideration of Rs     crore  After gaining control of Lyka Hetero Healthcare  the company is busy drawing up a turnaround plan that includes fresh investments for improving sales margins and addition of new molecules in cardiology and antibiotics  Hetero expects the buyout of the JV partner\'s stake in Lyka Hetero will give them the much-needed stability and foothold in the domestic market  With its expanded basket  including formulations in antibiotics  pain management and anti- asthmatic  Hetero is expecting to reduce its dependency on APIs considerably  "Most of our turnover comes from export of APIs  where price volatility is high  By attaining full ownership of Lyka Hetero Healthcare  we will be able to focus on marketing formulations in domestic market  This will help us to circumvent the volatility  making our bottomline stronger " Hetero Drugs director (marketing)  Srinivas Reddy  told ET  The company is likely to undertake a management restructuring as part of the turnaround  For the erstwhile joint venture  Hetero Drugs is looking to achieve a turnover of Rs   crore in one year against the present Rs   crore  "We found it difficult to chalk out marketing strategies within the confinement of a JV  Now we can focus on achieving sales volumes for the existing products  It will take  -  months for the new molecules to attain critical mass " Mr Reddy said  However  the company refused to make any comments on management restructuring  "The valuation process is on  It will take at least one month for us to finalise investments and other changes " he said  Lyka Hetero Healthcare was a  :  joint venture between Gujarat-based Lyka Labs and Hetero  It was floated to market Lyka\'s products in the domestic market  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Mahindra & Mahindra ends  -year defence JV with BAE Systems Distributed by Contify com   words   February   Domain-B ATDOMB English Copyright ©    The Information Company Pvt  Ltd  Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) today said that its subsidiary Mahindra Defence Systems will acquire BAE Systems\'  -per cent stake in their defence joint venture  Defence Land Systems India (DLSI)  ending a three-year partnership with Britain\'s biggest aerospace company  The move comes just a year after the London-based company appointed Dean McCumiskey as managing director and chief executive of its Indian operations in place of Andrew Gallagher in order to lead the next phase of BAE Systems\' business development in the country  (See: Dean McCumiskey to head BAE Systems in India (http: www domain-b com people in_the_news  _bae_systems html)) "This decision is a reflection of the shareholders\' belief that they can best meet emerging customer requirements and address the opportunities in this dynamic market with a flexible  tailored approach that was not easily facilitated by the structure of the existing joint-venture entity " both companies said in a joint statement  The two companies had set up the JV in   to develop new technologies and the manufacture of trusted armoured vehicles like the Axe  Rakshak  Marksman  up-armoured and bulletproof Scorpios and Boleros  and Rapid Intervention Vehicles  (See: Mahindra  BAE Systems set up defence JV for land systems (http: www domain-b com companies companies_m Mahindra  _mahindra_group_oneView html)) At present  DLSI produces combat vehicles such as Rakshak  Rakshak Plus  Marksman and MPVi  armoured bus  riot intervention vehicle and Scorpio Uparmoured for VIP security  The company\'s Prithla plant has a capacity to produce up to   vehicles a year  of which up to   are MPV-Is  In the last three to four years the company has invested about Rs  crore on the plant  Commenting on the development  Brigadier (Retd) Khutub Hai  chairman and MD of Mahindra Defence Systems  "This is a strategic decision and will enable both the companies to approach opportunities individually and to offer customised solutions to meet the needs of the Indian defence land systems domain " Dean McCumiskey said  "Building domestic capabilities in partnership with Indian companies will remain a cornerstone of our strategy in India  We look forward to opportunities to collaborate with Mahindra and others to enhance the role of the private sector in the defence industry " M&M also has a JV with US-based Telephonics Corp to make radar systems and another with UAE-based Arabia Holdings and Ras Al Khaimah Transport Investments to develop armored vehicles for the Middle East  Central Asia and African market  BAE also has a software engineering joint venture in India called BAeHA with Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL)  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  M&M to acquire Navistar\'s stake in MNAL Distributed by Contify com   words   January   Commercial Vehicle ACOMVE English Copyright ©   Next Gen Publishing  distributed by Contify com M&M and partner Navistar International Corporation have entered into an MoU  wherein the former will buy out the latter\'s equity in their JVs  Mahindra Navistar Automotives Ltd (MNAL) and Mahindra Navistar Engines Pvt Ltd (MNEPL)  Following the purchase  both MNAL and MNEPL would become wholly-owned subsidiaries of Mahindra  Mahindra would take complete ownership of operations and continue to sell MNEPL and MNAL products albeit under its own brand name  The sale requires regulatory approval in India  is subject to the conclusion of definitive agreements  and is expected to be completed in early    The terms of the proposed transaction call for Mahindra to pay approximately Rs   crores or USD   million  for Navistar group\'s stake in both ventures  The payout will happen in two parts  While    percent will be paid out as and when the deal goes through (upon the receipt of regulatory approvals)  the remainder will be payable five years from the date of the first payment  The agreement allows Navistar to continue sourcing components from India while Mahindra would continue to provide engineering services to Navistar  Navistar Group would continue to support M&M through a license agreement and extend necessary support to MNAL and MNEPL for the purposes of business continuity  Crucially  the agreement covers the localised Maxxforce     litre engine  \'Under the terms of our agreement  we can use the Maxxforce engine for as long as needed for business continuity  The engine may be deployed for the domestic market as well as export operations \' explains Dr  Goenka  President Automotive and Farm Equipment Sector  But  the engine is not exclusive to M&M ; Navistar can still commercially exploit it  subject to  \'a non-compete clause\'  Further investments So far  MNAL has registered sales of just     units in the last  -  years  significantly below expectation  This is because  any new player entering the Indian truck market has to contend with the strong incumbents  And the going has not been easy this year  thanks to the slowdown-induced spell of heavy discounting  Therefore  the JV has seen accumulated losses to the tune of Rs   crore  as against investments of Rs     crore  But this scenario has not dampened M&M\'s commitment to the CV industry  \'We stay committed to the truck and bus industry  Our dealers and trade partners are extremely happy with our intent to acquire Navistar\'s stake  As a matter of fact  we shall be investing more into the truck and bus business \' asserts Dr  Goenka  M&M reportedly intends to plough Rs  -  crore in a bid to turnaround MNAL\'s operations over the next three years  The investment is meant to support and expand the range of almost completely localised trucks and engines as also its robust dealer and service network  M&M is confident that it can succeed in the truck business on its own steam  \'Given that we have a product range that is well-suited to the Indian market\'s needs  we do not feel the immediate need for a foreign JV partner  But  to be honest  we have not yet applied serious thought to this aspect \' reveals Dr  Goenka  Navistar has decided to exit the JV because its finances are not in good shape  It has been the subject of investor activism and also the target of a speculated takeover by VW  What is more  a failed EPA   emissions compliance strategy saw longstanding Chairman Dan Ustian quit his position  Not surprisingly  the new management led by President and Chief Operating Officer  Troy Clarke is focussing on only those business areas that promise immediate return on capital under the \'Drive to Deliver\' programme  \'While the Indian market has not expanded as we had originally expected and industry challenges there continue in the near term  we still see promise in India going forward  But given Navistar\'s   priorities  our capital and focus needs to be allocated to other business opportunities in the near term \' Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  The end to the MNAL JV follows the recent dissolution of the MANFORCE JV  Industry observers believes that given the tough and competitive nature of India\'s auto industry  it is often difficult to align the visions of Indian and foreign partners  Indeed  buyout of a partner\'s stake is not an alien concept for M&M ; It has acquired Renault\'s stake in the erstwhile JV covering the localisation and sales of cars and utility vehicles under the Logan brand  In a possibly encouraging precedent for the truck business  the Logan  now badged Verito has been performing ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Apollo gets t(y)red  rolls out of Michelin JV   words   October   The Times of India TOI English (c)   The Times of India Group NEW DELHI: It was a mega tyre deal that Onkar Kanwar got tired of  Kanwar\'s Rs     crore Apollo Tyres on Friday scrapped its much-touted two-year-old truck and bus radial tyre making joint venture with French tyre maker Michelin  Apollo has decided to walk out of the venture blaming the slow growth in the radial tyre market and deferment in project implementation  Apollo will now sell its    stake in the the JV - christened Michelin Apollo Tyres Pvt Ltd (MATPL) - to its French partner at book value  Though company officials refused to divulge details of the financial transaction  sources said Apollo would get around    million for its    holding in the JV  The two firms  however  still remain partners as Michelin continues to hold      stake in Apollo Tyres  "There is no intention of buying back this stake from Michelin  and we will… … continue to explore opportunities for co-operation in India " a source said  The board of directors of Apollo Tyres on Friday approved the transfer of the JV\'s assets to Michelin  The proceeds from the stake sale will be used to expand Apollo\'s existing facilities and grow its presence in tyre market  MATPL was floated nearly two years back and the partners had agreed to set up a plant in Ranjangaon (Pune) with an initial investment of    million  the project is yet to get underway  "The decision is based on prevailing market conditions and the pace of radialisation in the truck and bus tyre segments  While the use of radial tyres has gone up in the past two years  it is at a pace slower than what was projected by the partners " Apollo said  The Ranjangaon venture will offer the existing range of Michelin products  it said  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  CORPORATE `Exit from Michelin joint venture not a setback for Apollo Tyres\' K R  Srivats   words   October   Business Line (The Hindu) BSNLNE   English (c)   The Hindu Business Line New Delhi   Oct   APOLLO Tyres Ltd does not see its exit from the Michelin Apollo Tyres Pvt Ltd (MATPL)  a  :   joint venture company with the Michelin group  as a "setback" in its efforts towards getting a slice of the high-potential truck and bus radial segment pie  "We will evolve a strategy for the truck and bus radial segment in the coming days  Our exit from the joint venture does not mean that we have had a setback or would not foray into truck and bus radial manufacturing in the future " Mr Sunam Sarkar  a member on the Apollo board  told Business Line    The company and the Michelin group on Friday agreed to "realign their business plans" and announced Apollo\'s exit from MATPL  Apollo Tyres had invested close to    million in the joint venture company  which was set up to manufacture truck and bus radial tyre for the domestic market  Mr Sarkar said that the slow pace of radialisation in the Indian truck and bus tyre segment (contributed by somewhat moderate progress in infrastructure build-up) had prompted Apollo Tyres to take a close look at its engagement with the joint venture company  "We will get almost entire amount invested in the joint venture company  We have neither lost or gained in financial terms " Mr Sarkar said  He added that the Michelin group would continue to hold the     per cent stake it acquired in Apollo Tyres two years ago  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  MICHELIN GEARS UP FOR ITS STRATEGY ROLL SANS APOLLO (the joint venture will be renamed  dual branded truck and bus tyres will be replaced by single branded Michelin tyres) Economic Times  Oct     ; pg     words   October   Indian Business Insight WIBI  -  English Copyright (c)   Informatics (India) Ltd  Michelin  the French tyre company  wants to continue its market approach strategy in India despite having lost its partner  Apollo Tyres  in its joint venture company  Michelin Apollo Tyres Ltd (MATL)  The original plan will continue and the focus will be on becoming the leader in the truck and bus radial market by    The joint venture company will be renamed to reflect its new ownership structure and single branded Michelin tyres would replace the dual-branded truck and bus tyres  The proposed   -million truck and bus radial plant at Ranjangaon  near Pune  to produce   lakh tyres has been temporarily shelved but will be taken up once the radial market matures  In the meanwhile  Michelin will continue to import Khomba Singh   words   February   The Economic Times ECTIM English (c)   The Times of India Group  All rights reserved  NEW DELHI: New York Life Insurance Company plans to sell its near-   stake in Max New York Life Insurance in a transaction that could see it sharing about one-third of its sale proceeds with Analjit Singh-led Max India  its local partner in the joint venture  According to a person familiar with the development  New York Life  the US-based insurer  is in talks with a few European and Japanese companies as it seeks to exit India as part of its strategy to withdraw from Asia and focus on its home market of North America  As part of the strategy  New York Life has divested its stake in operations in Thailand  Hong Kong  South Korea and China since last year  The US insurer has agreed to pay around one-third of the sale proceeds to its local partner for its contribution in building the business and creating its valuation as well as for giving consent for the deal  even though Max India is not selling any shares itself  New York Life\'s stake in the Indian insurance JV is estimated to be worth around Rs     crore and Max India could end up earning Rs    -    crore on the basis of this valuation  "Our JV is a highly successful operation that provides important insurance products to the people of India  We do not comment on rumours " said a New York Life spokesman  Max India did not respond to an emailed query  Max New York Life  the country\'s largest non-banking private insurer  was incorporated in   and is one of the earliest joint venture companies involving a foreign partner  In addition to New York Life  Max India has a    stake in the company and Axis Bank holds the remaining    The money earned by Max India from the transaction will be used to make good its accumulated losses in the insurance business and also scout for inorganic growth opportunities  said the person quoted above  For Reprint Rights: timescontent com Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Nippon Chemiphar  Ranbaxy Terminate Alliance   words   December   Pharma Japan PHJP   English (c)    Jiho  Inc  All rights reserved  Nippon Chemiphar and Ranbaxy Laboratories terminated their comprehensive business alliance  including capital ties  on December    How the two companies will move in the market for generics in Japan has been watched with great interest since Daiichi Sankyo acquired Ranbaxy in    They have finally decided to terminate their relationship initiated in   and independently follow their own path  Fifty percent of the shares of Nihon Pharmaceutical Industry (NPI) owned by Ranbaxy were acquired by Nippon Chemiphar for Y    billion on the same day  NPI will continue to market four generics introduced from Ranbaxy and sell them through Nippon Chemiphar in Japan  Annual sales of these four products are approximately Y  billion  The effect of the deal on its business will be “minimal ”according to Nippon Chemiphar  Ranbaxy acquired    of shares of NPI  a subsidiary of Nippon Chemiphar  in    and increased its ownership to    in    However  its acquisition by Daiichi Sankyo has basically changed its strategy  and it has been obliged to reconsider its relationship with Nippon Chemiphar  According to Nippon Chemiphar  the two companies have been discussing the new partnership since summer in    At the beginning  they discussed how to continue  not to terminate  their partnership  As they reviewed their mutual strategy  however  they have reached a conclusion that the best for both companies is to independently develop their own business  “This is a friendly  forward-looking decision ”according to Nippon Chemiphar  “I don\'t think Nippon Chemiphar will be able to fully develop its generics business on its own  We will consider partnering ”said President Kazushiro Yamaguchi of Nippon Chemiphar at a press conference in July   commenting on the possibility of M&As and alliances for the development of his company\'s generics business  At present  however  the company is not negotiating alliances with any foreign-affiliated generic company  according to the company\'s Public Relations Department  Daiichi Sankyo has not clarified its generics business policy in Japan  “We are analyzing recent market trends and weighing all possible options ”said a spokesperson for the company  Page requirement  please contact Editor at htsyndication@hindustantimes com Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Ashok Leyland completes acquisition of LCV JVs with Nissan Anil Sharma   words   November   IHS Global Insight Daily Analysis WDAN English Copyright    IHS Global Insight Limited  All Rights Reserved  Ashok Leyland has completed the acquisition of three joint ventures (JVs) with Nissan  the company said in a statement  The three JVs in question are Ashok Leyland Nissan Vehicles Ltd (ALNVL) for vehicle manufacturing; Nissan Ashok Leyland Power Train Ltd (NALPT) for making powertrains; and Nissan Ashok Leyland Technologies Ltd (NALT)  a technology JV  All the three JVs operate in the light commercial vehicle (LCV) space  As part of the agreement reached between Ashok Leyland and Nissan  the latter transferred its shareholding in the three ventures to the former for a consolidated consideration of INR  (USD   )  Ashok Leyland will continue to build the Dost  Partner  and Mitr LCVs  while servicing and parts availability for customers will be taken care of by a Nissan technical support team  Significance: The completion of the transaction is on expected lines as the competition watchdog in India had already cleared the deal agreed between the partners (see India:   November  : )  The two companies signed the JVs in   in an effort to gain a foothold in India\'s light and medium commercial vehicle market  However  the partnership did not go as planned with delays in product launches  declining sales  widening losses  and write-offs  Except for the Dost  the venture did not have any commercial success and the slower introduction of additional variants further contributed to the losses  Early this year  the differences between the partners came out into the public domain and subsequent development resulted in an exchange of legal notices to each other before both the parties decided to call off the partnership in September (see Japan – India:   September  : )  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Industry End of the Road for Nissan\'s JVs with Ashok Leyland   words   September   The Economic Times ECTIM English (c)   The Times of India Group  All rights reserved  New Delhi: Japanese auto major Nissan Motor agreed to sell its entire stake in three joint ventures to partner Ashok Leyland  ending their eight-yearold collaboration  Ashok Leyland and Nissan had formed the JVs -Ashok Leyland Nissan Vehicles for vehicle manufacturing; Nissan Ashok Leyland Power Train for making power trains and Nissan Ashok Leyland Technologies  which is a technology joint venture -in    The partners had invested about Rs      crore as equity between them  “Under the agreement signed on September      by senior executives of Nissan and Ashok Leyland  these joint ventures will become wholly owned Ashok Leyland subsidiaries  upon receipt of all necessary approvals from the regulatory authorities in India “ the com panies said in a joint statement  The process is expected to finish this year  The firms declined to disclose details of the financial implications  As per the restructured agreement  Ashok Leyland will continue to build under a licensing agreement light commercial vehicles Dost and Partner  which are based on Nissan\'s design  engineering and technology  Servicing and parts availability for customers will be ensured by a technical support arrangement  In addition  the two have agreed to continue a deal to pro reed to continue a deal to procure made-in-India parts for Nissan  “We have decided to acquire Nissan\'s stake in the three joint venture companies  and this will help focus our efforts to concentrate on core business initiatives and customers  We will continue our relationship with Nissan under the new arrangement “ said Ashok Leyland MD Vinod Dasari  “Nissan and Ashok Leyland coming together was a good idea  There were differences in the way both companies wanted to approach the market and operationalise their strategies  This impacted volumes & culminated in the split “ said VG Ramakrishnan  managing partner  Avanteum Advisors  For Reprint Rights: is operator of the project  said in a statement that the divestment is part of its strategy to focus more on its shale gas explorations business  Reliance group  which holds      in the JV through arm Reliance Holding USA  is also pursuing sale of its stake  In a separate statement to Indian bourses  RIL said  "Reliance has also agreed to consider a divestment of its shareholding in this joint venture The current investments in EFS Midstream LLC is     million " The Midstream business of Eagle Ford owns and runs   gathering plants and around   miles of pipelines  The JV  which was formed in    is likely to generate    million in cash flow in    the statement said  "The sale of EFS Midstream would allow us to strategically redeploy capital to our core  oil-rich Spraberry Wolfcamp assets in the Permian Basin of West Texas  where we are successfully transforming the substantial resource potential we delineated in   into strong production growth " said Scott D Sheffield  chairman and CEO  Pioneer Natural Resources  in the statement  "We currently have no plans to divest our Eagle Ford Shale upstream assets  The sale of EFS Midstream is not expected to impact our ability to export processed Eagle Ford condensate " he said  Reliance Industries  Pioneer Resources to sell off stake in US company Last month  commenting on media reports that RIL may sell its stake in the Eagle Ford JV at an estimated      billion  RIL\'s chief financial officer Alok Agarwal said  "Eagle Ford is the most successful joint venture and it has gained a very decent amount of valuation in the last   months  Our partners and we are looking at what\'s best for the JV going forward " Besides  its stake in Eagle Ford  RIL owns stakes in two more shale ventures in the US  RIL owns    in Chevron\'s Marcellus shale asset and    in and asset of the Carrizo Oil and Gas Inc in Central and Northeast Pennsylvania  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Reliance  RTL end Indian venture AndyDickens   words   July   C  Media C MD English (c)  C  Media Ltd India’s Reliance Broadcast Network and Europe’s RTL Group have ended their joint venture behind action-orientated channel Big RTL Thrill  Reliance teamed up with RTL in   to operate the network  which launched in   with dubbed content from FremantleMedia  Endemol and Red Bull  The channel was initially broadcast in the Uttar Pradesh region before expanding into Mumbai  Kolkatta  Delhi  Maharashtra and Gujarat  A year ago RTL expanded the channel with an English-language feed  The split  which marks the exit of RTL from Indian TV  was mooted at the end of April when Anil Ambani’s Reliance bought out the company’s stake in the     JV  Just months ago Reliance and CBS Studios International ended their three-year-old JV  which operated Big CBS Prime  Big CBS Love and youth-skewing Big CBS Spark  Big RTL Thrill will be rebranded as Big Thrill  Reliance CEO Tarun Katial said the firm will begin investing in regional programming by the end of the year and hopes to add “local male action content” and new concepts  Big Thrill and its sister channel Big Magic  which focuses on comedy  are available on DTH platforms TEAM VCC   words   September   VC Circle MMVVCC English Copyright    Mosaic Media Ventures Pvt  Ltd  Ad-for-equity media investor BCCL is a shareholder in the venture  Religare Enterprises Ltd  the public listed holding company of a string of financial services businesses  said on Thursday that it would exit its life insurance joint venture with its Dutch partner Aegon  The firm currently holds   per cent in Aegon Religare Life Insurance Co Ltd  while Aegon owns   per cent stake  The remaining   per cent is with ad-for-equity media investor Bennett  Coleman and Company Ltd (BCCL)  the firm behind media publications and TV channels like The Times of India and Times Now  “After a strategic review  Religare has expressed a desire to exit the joint venture  Religare and Aegon have agreed that Religare will exit once a replacement shareholder is identified and is approved by the regulatory authorities ” Religare said  The FDI ceiling for insurance sector is in the process of being hiked to   per cent which would allow Aegon to buy a part of the stake held by Religare  However  Religare would need to find other buyers for its remaining holding  Aegon is an international provider of life insurance  pension and asset management  With headquarters in The Hague  the Netherlands  its companies employ over     people serving millions of customers across the globe  Its main operations are in the US  the Netherlands and the UK  but in recent years the company has expanded into new growth markets in Asia  Central & Eastern Europe and Latin America  There are   life insurance firms in the country including state-run Life Insurance Co  Religare Aegon is the  st ranked life insurer among the   private life insurers in the country as per first premium collection for the period ended June       It had launched its pan-India operations in July    following a multi-channel distribution strategy  Religare Enterprises share price closed at Rs     each  down     per cent on the BSE in a weak Mumbai market on Thursday  In another deal in the life insurance space  Kishore Biyani-led Future Group sold     per cent stake in Future Generali India Life Insurance Company Ltd to Industrial Investment Trust Ltd (IITL) last year  Also real estate developer DLF had sold its   per cent stake sale in DLF Pramerica Life Insurance Company Ltd -- its life insurance joint venture with Prudential International Inc – to Dewan Finance Corporation Ltd and its group entities  The firm has now been renamed as DHFL Pramerica Life Insurance  (Edited by Joby Puthuparampil Johnson) Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  BUSINESS Religare exits MF biz  sells    to partner Invesco   words   November   Press Trust of India PRTRIN English Copyright    The Press Trust of India Limited  New Delhi  Nov   (PTI) After life insurance  financial services group Religare Enterprises has decided to exit mutual fund business with sale of its controlling   per cent stake in Religare Invesco AMC to the foreign partner Invesco  While a number of foreign fund houses have exited the Indian mutual fund industry -- the latest being Goldman Sachs -- there have not been many cases where Indian entities have sold the asset management business  Earlier this year  Religare had sold its stake in its life insurance join venture  In May    Religare had announced that it will exit Aegon Religare Life Insurance Company by selling its stake to existing partner Bennett  Coleman and Company Ltd (BCCL) of the Netherlands  Religare did not disclose the exact reasons for the sale of mutual fund business but sources said that the capital is being unlocked through mutual fund  The funds through stake sale will be used for health insurance and lending platform  The shares of Religare reacted negatively to the announcement and settled down at     per cent on the BSE in a strong broader market today  While the Indian mutual fund industry has been growing steadily  Religare Invesco has not seen any major upsurge in its asset under management in the recent past  Its average assets under management (AUM) stood at Rs     crore for the quarter ended September  only marginally higher than Rs     crore as on March   this year  In between  it had fallen to Rs     crore in the quarter ended June  Without disclosing the deal size  Religare said in a statement that it has entered into a definitive agreement under which Invesco would increase its stake to   per cent in the joint venture  The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals  Religare held   per cent in the JV while Invesco currently has   per cent ownership  Invesco\'s Senior Managing Director and Head of Asia Pacific Andrew Lo said it would further deepen its presence in India by taking full ownership of this business  Religare Group CEO Shachindra Nath termed Invesco\'s decision as "an endorsement of the Indian macros" and also of the overall quality of the management team  Saurabh Nanavati will continue as CEO  along with the existing senior management team of the fund house  Invesco had purchased   per cent stake in March    wherein it was also given an option to further increase its stake before March    In the recent past  a number of foreign fund houses have exited the Indian mutual fund market  but in most of those cases  the businesses were acquired by Indian entities  The latest deal  therefore  goes against the prevailing trend  PTI BJ SP MR Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  News Ruchi Soya  Kagome end India tomato joint venture  Dean equity in the company and the remaining   per cent was held by Sansera Engineering Pvt Ltd  it added  The company is located in Bangalore and will now be Streparava\'s wholly-owned Indian venture  it (c)   Asia Pulse Pty Limited  New Delhi  January      (PTI) -- India\'s largest lender State Bank of India (SBI) today said it has cancelled a proposed merchant acquiring business joint venture with US-based Elavon Incorporation and Visa International  The bank has cancelled the negotiations for establishing a joint venture entity with Visa Inc and Elavon Inc for conducting the merchant acquiring business  SBI informed the BSE  The merchant acquiring business involves facilitation of payments through debit or credit cards at retail outlets  The RBI had already approved the setting up of a wholly owned subsidiary by SBI in the name of SBI Payment Services for conducting the merchant acquiring business  The proposed joint venture between SBI Payment Services Pvt Ltd (a wholly owned subsidiary of SBI)  Visa Inc and Elavon Inc was first mooted in    it said  In    the bank had floated a Request For Proposal (RFP) for selection of joint venture (JV) partners for the merchant acquiring business  The business was to include acquisition of bank identification numbers (BINs) and providing managed services for point-of-sale (PoS) terminals  The managed services would have included deployment of POS terminals at customer locations  their replacement  merchant training and maintenance  among others  State Bank of India Group presently has over     ATMs across the country Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Corporate Tata Metaliks Ends Water Pipes JV with Japanese Cos OUR BUREAU KOLKATA   words   March   The Economic Times - Mumbai Edition ECTMUM English Copyright ©    Bennett  Coleman & Co  Ltd  Move seen to be in line with plan to integrate the pipe-making facility with itself Tata Metaliks has ended its joint venture for manufacturing drinking water pipes with Japanese partners  Kubota and Metal One  The move is seen as a prelude to a larger plan towards integrating the pipe-making facility with TML  The joint venture  Tata MetaliksKubota Pipes (TMKPL) was incorporated in July   as a    subsidiary of TML  with the Japanese partners Kubota and Metal One holding    and    stake  respectively "To start with  TML will acquire    stake by buying out its Japanese partners in TMKPL  After which  the pipemaking business will be brought under TML\'s fold  We continue to see a lot of prospect in the business " said Harsh Jha  managing director of Tata Metaliks  who is due to retire on Friday "We have separate agreements through which Tata Metaliks will continue to get technical and international marketing support from Kubota " he added  While there is an obvious tax advantage in the proposed move  TML\'s board is also weighing other options for TMKPL that will attract tax benefits  This includes making TMKPL a conversion agent of TML  A clearer picture may emerge shortly  with the board due to take a call on it in the next three to four weeks "The company signed an agreement with Kubota and Metal One on March      terminating the joint venture agreement being executed from July     in relation to Tata MetaliksKubota Pipes  subsidiary of the company " Tata Metaliks said to the BSE  SEVERE COMPETITION TMKPL  in which the partners had invested around   crore  was affected by severe price competition in ductile iron (DI) pipes and was upstaged by intense price cutting by regional players in the last four to five years  Hit by low net realisations in an industry facing overcapacity  especially in the eastern region  TMKPL\'s margins suffered "At one point  price of pig iron and DI pipes were at the same level  There was no premium on value addition which is absurd  The DI pipe market is essentially led by projects  There is no concept of marketshare  The situation worsened till it became economically unsustainable for a lot of companies that were operating at very low capacity " said an industry analyst  MINING CRISIS Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Tata Metaliks\' main business  too  has been affected due to irregular supplies of iron ore since the mining crisis broke out in Karnataka and Goa  In particular  it was forced to close down operations at its Redi plant at Sindhudurg  Maharashtra in October    Earlier this week  it signed a memorandum of settlement with the Tata Metaliks Workers\' Union at Redi in respect of all permanent employees in pursuance of its plans to close down operation there  Plans to sell off its Redi plant last year suffered after it failed to clinch a deal with the proposed buyer  Fomento  Snapping Ties JV WAS INCORPORATED IN   with Japanese partners Kubota and Metal One holding    and    stake  respectively WHILE THERE IS AN OBVIous tax advantage in the proposed move  TML\'s board is also weighing other options for TMKPL that will attract tax benefits Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Front Page Fiat goes solo on logistics  snapping last link with Tata   words   March   Financial Express AIWFIE English Copyright   Indian Express Online Media Pvt  Ltd  The last of the links between Fiat in India and Tata Motors as far as sales and distribution goes has come to an end  While Fiat went independent with its sales and dealership network from May    the distribution and outbound logistics piece was still being handled by Tata Motors  Fiat\'s dependence on Tata Motor\'s network will end in March  From April    Fiat Group Automobiles India  Fiat\'s sales and distribution arm  will be switching over to a new partner  Fiat has brought in their distribution and logistic partner from Italy to handle their logistics and distribution in India from their plant at Ranjangaon  near Pune  Mercurio Pallia Logistics will take over the distribution logistics of Fiat cars  Mercurio Pallia a joint venture company between Gruppo Mercurio of Italy and Pallia Transport of India  Gruppo Mercurio is owned by Gefco Logistics  Fiat works with Gefco in Italy and some European markets  Gefco is a subsidiary of Peugeot of France and is into vehicle transport and distribution business across the globe with a turnover of     billion euro  Robert DeCrick  head  supply chain management (APAC)  Fiat Chrysler  said  "They chose to go with an expert in the business rather than doing it themselves  This is not about fencing some agriculture land and starting to park on it  Unlike the car yards in India  the new Fiat stockyard was built on a solid surface with safety and security that ensure a better quality car was delivered to the customer  The yard also used IT extensively to offer better visibility for the dealership from invoice to delivery at the dealerships " On whether this investment in logistics would put an additional burden on the comapny\'s costs  DeCrick said they did not view logistics as cost but as a key part of their business  The new logistics partner will be able to handle customer demands better and with the use of technology dealers will he happier as they will be able to track their supplies from invoice to the delivery of cars at their dealerships  DeCrick said  As of now Fiat has   dealerships and is adding six nee dealership in two weeks  The target is to reach   dealerships by December    Fiat earlier had a network of   dealers through Tata Motors  Though the six year sales tie-up has ended  the manufacturing JV between Tata Motors and Fiat India remains intact  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  BUSINESS RBI clears way for Tatas to buy back from DOCOMO Special Correspondent   words   January   The Hindu THINDU English (c)   Kasturi & Sons Ltd MUMBAI BUSINESS The Tatas are close to buying back NTT DOCOMO’s     per cent stake in Tata Teleservices Ltd (TTSL) at an earlier agreed upon price of Rs     crore as the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is understood to have relaxed its fair value pricing norm as a special case to enable them to honour their commitment made to the Japanese company  The easing of norms comes following enhanced business ties between India and Japan  The RBI’s fair value pricing norm does not allow companies to buy back shares at more price than the fair market value  and this is why the Tata- NTT DOCOMO deal could not be completed despite several notices from NTT DOCOMO and even the Japanese company initiating arbitration proceedings against Tata Sons and TTSL in London to recover its money  “Tata Sons has made the necessary application to the Reserve Bank of India  The company is awaiting a response ” a Tata Sons spokesperson said while responding to queries  In March     NTT DOCOMO had invested      billion in TTSL to pick up     per cent stake  The shareholder’s agreement had guaranteed it at least   per cent of the investment if it wished to exit in case of TTSL failing to meet certain performance targets  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Corporate PE Firm Actis to Exit Road JV with Tatas ARIJIT BARMAN MUMBAI   words   May   The Economic Times - Mumbai Edition ECTMUM English Copyright ©    Bennett  Coleman & Co  Ltd  Tata Opportunity Fund to buy out the PE firm in the JV and form an infra entity that will  to start with  acquire three road projects of IVRCL Three years after private equity firm Actis and the Tata Group formed a   -million JV - with an ambitious plan to spend ten times of that sum in building roads over five years - the venture is coming to an end  Actis is set to pull out of the JV and the Tatas have agreed to buy them out  said multiple sources aware of the ongoing transaction  Currently  Tata Realty & Infrastructure (TRIL)  a    subsidiary of Tata Sons  owns    of the venture called TRIL Roads while Actis owns the rest  TRIL was Tata Sons\' initial vehicle for its foray into infrastructure and real estate development  The Tata-Actis disengagement is likely to conclude within a month "Actis will make a marginal return on its investments  Its focus has moved away from roads into power generation and distribution and it will continue to focus on these sectors through its infrastructure funds  This will be an amenable exit " said an official  Actis\' exit is being facilitated by another Tata Group entity  Tata Opportunities Fund (TOF)  the group\'s captive PE fund which will buy them out  Actis PE\'s India head JM Trivedi could not be reached for comments  Spokespersons from Tata Groups\' external media agency Rediffusion did not respond to ET\'s detailed questionnaire  London headquartered Actis - which was spun off from the Commonwealth Development Corporation nine years ago - had invested      million (   crore) for its minority stake  in what was then its first investment in the Indian infrastructure space  This money was deployed from its   -million (     crore) emerging markets focussed infrastructure fund  Close to    of the fund\'s proceeds were initially earmarked for India  Despite its initial ambitious plans  TRIL Roads and Actis has till date built only one project  the  -km Pune-Solapur highway with Italian company Atlantia SpA as its technical partner  for     crore  But with TOF on board  TRIL Roads plans to pursue inorganic opportunities in the sector  TRIL-TOF TO BUY   IVRCL ROAD PROJECTS To start with  it is already in negotiations to buy the three road projects of cash-strapped infrastructutre company IVRCL - Salem Tollways  Kumarapalayam Tollways and Changapally-Wallayar Tollways  The three roads have been built on an estimated cost of     crore  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  In April this year  IVRCL entered into an agreement with TRIL Roads to transfer control in these three road projects  in an effort to monetise its build-operate-transfer assets  But in accordance with the terms of the concession agreement  TRIL Roads will separately buy    in Salem and Kumarapalayam Tollways as they are already operational  IVRCL will continue with a    exposure  However  for the Changapally-Wallayar Tollways  initially TRIL Roads will pick up only    and upon completion of the project in the next five months  it will hike its stake to    After two years  IVRCL will exit entirely as the model concession agreement signed post   allows it to do so  Concessional agreement signed before   requires the original promoter to hold a minimum   "We have all the necessary approvals from NHAI  We are just awaiting the lenders nod  We hope to conclude the deal in the next   days " said S Ramachandran  director  IVRCL Infrastructures & Projects  Tatas will be shelling out around   crore as equity for the IVRCL deal  while     crore of debt and other liabilities will get transferred to them "One good thing about the three roads is that by FY   all three are expected to achieve breakeven  But these are just
