reserved  Indian billionaire Dilip Shanghvi drops plans to form payments bank with IDFC  Telenor   words   May    :  Reuters News LBA English Copyright   Thomson Reuters  All Rights Reserved  MUMBAI  May   (Reuters) - India\'s second richest man  Dilip Shanghvi  said on Friday he had shelved plans to form a payments bank jointly with the Indian financial firm IDFC Bank and an arm of Norway\'s Telenor  but did not disclose the reason  Shanghvi\'s company  Dilip Shanghvi Family and Associates  was among   firms that were awarded licences last August to set up niche "payments banks" aimed at granting millions of Indians access to basic banking  The banks are a part of India\'s financial inclusion push and are meant to expand banking services in a country where less than half of the adult population holds a bank account  Shanghvi  who is the founder and head of India\'s largest drugmaker Sun Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd  said he had worked with IDFC and Telenor over the past eight months to make a framework and governance structure for the joint venture  "Following the mutual decision to withdraw these plans  the payment bank license will not be pursued " Shanghvi said in a statement  (Reporting by Zeba Siddiqui in Mumbai  editing by David Evans) Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Front Page Unitech settles dispute with Telenor  to exit JV   words   October   Financial Express AIWFIE English Copyright   Indian Express Online Media Pvt  Ltd  Norwegian telecom operator Telenor and India\'s real estate firm Unitech on Thursday agreed to settle all their disputes amicably by withdrawing all the cases slapped against each other  The development brings to an end the long-drawn out dispute between the two since the Supreme Court cancelled their JV firm Uninor\'s   licences in its February   order  Under the terms of agreement while Unitech  which holds      will exit the JV upon receiving payment of a nominal amount  Telenor would be able to transfer all assets of Uninor to a new company and bid in the upcoming  G spectrum auction  Telenor would be free to get a new Indian partner to meet the mandatory    stake by an Indian firm in a telecom services company  However  Unitech would continue to retain economic rights in the company as per its current shareholding  This means that if any benefits accrue to the firm in terms of refund of licence fees of taxes  Unitech would be entitled to them as per its shareholding  The two parties also informed the Delhi High Court on Thursday that they have resolved their disputes amicably  Telenor had bought      stake in Unitech Wireless (Uninor) in   for R    crore  "Telenor and Unitech are pleased to announce that on October       they have reached an agreement to amicably settle all disputes between the two parties  The parties are bound by confidentiality obligations  and are  therefore  not able to provide any further comments on specific terms and conditions of the settlement  However  it can be confirmed that the parties agree to support the transfer of the business in Unitech Wireless (Uninor) to a new entity controlled by Telenor " the statement issued by the two sides said  With immediate effect  Unitech would withdraw all its nominees from Uninor\'s board and all its special shareholder rights will stand suspended  As for Unitech  with the settlement of disputes with Telenor  the realty firm will focus on its core business of real estate  "We are pleased with the settlement reached between Unitech and Telenor  All existing disputes with Telenor are suspended and will be withdrawn upon successful transfer of business of Uninor to a new entity controlled by Telenor " Unitech chairman Ramesh Chandra said  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  FT com site : Tesco ends talks on India joint venture  Elizabeth Rigby and Nayantara Rai in London   words   November   Financial Times (FT Com) FTCOM English (c)   The Financial Times Limited  All rights reserved Tesco of the UK admitted on Friday that its plan to be the first multinational supermarket retailer in India has unravelled  The world\'s fifth-biggest supermarket chain said it had ended talks with Bharti Enterprises to set up a joint venture in India\'s GBP bn-a-year (  bn) retail sector after discussions failed  It now looks like Wal-Mart  the biggest global retailer  could lead the advance into the world\'s eighth-largest retail market  Sunil Mittal  the telecommunications tycoon who controls Bharti  refused to be drawn on his negotiations with Tesco  "We will make an announcement shortly on a global partner for our retail foray " he told the Financial Times  Tesco  Carrefour and Wal-Mart have been linked to Bharti  but it appears that only the US chain is still in the race  It is thought that the Tesco-Bharti deal fell apart in the final stages of the talks after the two parties failed to find common ground on the pace of expansion  with Bharti opting for a more aggressive opening programme than Tesco envisaged  Tesco is also thought to have felt frustrated by leaks about the talks  Under Indian rules  no foreign direct investment is allowed in the retail sector  except for single-brand stores  which means big groups have to sign a franchise or licensing agreement with local companies  India is on track to become the fifth-biggest retail market by    according to McKinsey  Organised retailing makes up   per cent of the market  giving big chains scope to expand  Confirming that it had walked away from discussions with Bharti  Tesco said: "We remain excited by the opportunities available in India " Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Companies Titagarh Wagons-FreightCar America dissolve Indian JV P  R  Sanjai   words   February   Mint HNMINT English Copyright    HT Media Limited  All rights reserved  Mumbai  Feb    -- Wgaon manufacturing company Titagarh Wagons Ltd (TWL) and FreightCar America Inc  (FCA)  on Saturday  said they have agreed to wind up and dissolve their Indian joint venture company  The joint venture company  Titagarh FreightCar Pvt  Ltd  was incorporated in India pursuant to a   joint-venture agreement between the parties with the objective of manufacturing and selling aluminium coal-carrying rail wagons in India  Soon after its incorporation  the joint venture company had begun the process of obtaining approval from the Indian Railways-Research Designs and Standards Organisation (RDSO) for aluminium wagon designs adapted for use on the Indian rail system  TWL said in stock exchange filing  However  they said that over time it became clear that approval from the RDSO would not be obtained in an acceptable time-frame  "The joint venture company formally notified the RDSO in June   that it would not further pursue its request for design approval " the statement said  "We had big plans for the joint venture company when it was incorporated in    However  those plans were not realized despite considerable effort  After lengthy discussions  Titagarh Wagons and FreightCar America have decided to dissolve the joint venture company and part ways amicably " said Umesh Chowdhary  vice-chairman and managing director of TWL Published by HT Syndication with permission from MINT  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Bharti Airtel acquires    in Qualcomm India for Rs   cr BS Reporter New Delhi   words   May   Business Standard BSTN   English (c)   Business Standard Ltd  Enterprise valued at Rs     cr; Bharti can offer  G services in key Mumbai  Delhi circles Bharti Airtel  the country’s largest mobile operator  today announced the acquisition of   per cent stake in US telecom major Qualcomm Inc’s broadband wireless access (BWA) company in India for an initial investment of    million (Rs   crore)  With this move  Bharti Airtel will become a key player in the  G LTE market  with a presence in eight of the   circles in the country  The acquisition of Qualcomm’s licence is crucial  as it will give Bharti an entry into four key circles: the lucrative Delhi and Mumbai markets as well as Haryana and Kerala  Bharti  on its own  has  G spectrum in four circles  including Kolkata  where it has already launched services  Karnataka  Punjab and Maharashtra  Under the agreement  Bharti will acquire the   per cent each held by Global Holding Corporation Private Ltd (part of the GTL group) and Tulip Telecom Ltd  to whom it is paying around Rs   crore each  The premium the two investors will earn from the deal comes to an annualised return of around   per cent on their investment  The balance equity has been bought by way of subscription of fresh equity in the entity  The deal also contemplates that once commercial operations are launched  subject to certain terms and conditions being met  Bharti would also pick up the remaining   per cent stake by May    Qualcomm had forked out Rs     crore to win the BWA licence and paid the money through a combination of debt and equity  That included about Rs     crore in equity and the rest through debt  The interest on the debt for the last two years that the company forked out while waiting for spectrum comes to around Rs     crore  Based on this  the enterprise value of the company stands around Rs     crore  Barclays was mandated by Qualcomm to structure the deal  The US company received its spectrum just a few weeks ago after a bitter battle with the DoT (Department of Telecommunications) and after it moved the TDSAT following a delay of nearly two years  The DoT gave it the spectrum but with the licence period reduced from   years to      The roll-out obligation time was also reduced from five years to three and a half  Commenting on the deal  Sunil Bharti Mittal  chairman and managing director  Bharti Airtel  said  “This partnership will combine the strength of Bharti’s national telecom footprint and Qualcomm’s technological leadership in the LTE TDD space  With a broadband-ready network across India  Bharti is well positioned to lead the next phase of Indian’s telecom revolution ” Apart from  G  Bharti has  G services in   circles  Bharti added in its press release that with the deal  “it secured nationwide broadband leadership through a combination of  G and  G  with its own networks in   circles”  “One of our key objectives has been to include a strong partner in the Indian venture with the scale  experience and resources to deploy LTE TDD networks  We are pleased to have Bharti’s participation and support in this effort ” said Paul E Jacobs  chairman and CEO of Qualcomm  Tulip Telecom chairman H S Bedi confirmed his company had been paid Rs   crore for the   per cent stake  “Yes  we have been paid Rs   crore  which is at a premium to what we had spent ” Asked how the Rs   crore that Qualcomm has paid to the DoT on Tulip Telecom’s behalf for disputed dues  as directed by the TDSAT  Bedi said  “We had an agreement with Qualcomm that only after we had exhausted all options and not found a remedy would we pay the money back  However  I am confident this is an erroneous demand by the DoT ” Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  According to top sources  Bharti has also been talking to Aircel for an alliance in the BWA space  which could include using its network to get into seven more circles  According to sources  the circles that have been identified include Andhra Pradesh  Assam  Bihar  the north-east  Odisha  Tamil Nadu and West Bengal  Depending on the final policy and judgments on whether inter-circle roaming would be deemed legal  the move could help Bharti become a pan-India  G player  with presence in   circles  That would bring it head to head with the only other pan-India player  Reliance Infotel  which is preparing for a major launch by the end of this year  Bharti  however  said it would not like to comment on speculation  Aircel did not comment  Qualcomm had made it public it would not like to get into the services business and would divest stake to partners  Its main interest in bidding for BWA spectrum was to ensure operators used it to launch services on LTE  a technology it has been backing over Wimax  The US company’s main interest is to make money by selling chipsets for  G devices  The company is working on chipsets that will support devices to seamlessly move between  G   G and  G without the customer realising the change  Qualcomm expects to provide technical assistance to Bharti in connection with network architecture and optimisation  infrastructure and device testing  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Bharti Airtel acquires    in Qualcomm India for Rs   cr BS Reporter New Delhi   words   May already launched services  Karnataka  Punjab and Maharashtra  Under the agreement  Bharti will acquire the   per cent each held by Global Holding Corporation Private Ltd (part of the GTL group) and balance equity has been bought by way of subscription of fresh equity in the entity  The deal also contemplates that once commercial operations are launched  subject to certain terms and conditions being met  Bharti would also pick up the remaining   per cent stake by May    Qualcomm had forked out Rs     crore to win the BWA licence and paid the money through a combination of debt and equity crore  Based on this  the enterprise value of the company stands around Rs     crore  Barclays was mandated by Qualcomm to structure the deal  The US company received its spectrum just a few weeks ago after a bitter battle with the DoT (Department of Telecommunications) and after it moved the TDSAT following a delay of nearly two years  The DoT gave it the spectrum but with the licence period reduced from   years to      The roll-out obligation time was also reduced from five years to three and a half  Commenting on the deal  Sunil Bharti Mittal  chairman and managing director  Bharti secured nationwide broadband leadership through a combination of  G and  G  with its own networks in   circles”  “One of our key objectives has been to include a strong partner in the Indian venture with the scale  experience and resources to deploy LTE TDD networks  We are pleased to have Bharti’s participation and support in this effort ” said Paul E Jacobs  chairman and CEO of Qualcomm  Tulip operation — will supply Mahindra & Mahindra and VE Commercial Vehicles Ltd  The plant  on a    -acre site  has injection presses ranging from  -  tons of clamping force  The second plant  in Bangalore  will open next year  It will supply Honda Motorcycle & Scooters India (HMSI) and automotive plants around Bangalore  Sharma said  The third plant  in Chennai  will open in   and serve the Asia-Pacific News Agencies OANA English © Copyright    OANA  All rights reserved  New Delhi (PTI) Putting an end to the corporate battle  UK-based Vodafone Thursday announced it would exercise the option to acquire its Indian partner Essar\'s   per cent stake which will result in payment of USD five billion  With this  Vodafone may have to look for another domestic partner to remain compliant with the FDI norms in the telecom sector of a maximum stake of   per cent  "Vodafone Group announces that the Essar Group has exercised its underwritten put option over   per cent of Vodafone Essar Limited (VEL)  "Following the exercise by the Essar Group of its put option  Vodafone has exercised its call option over the remaining   per cent of VEL owned by the Essar Group  resulting in a total cash payment of USD   billion " Vodafone said in a statement  Call Option allows an investor the right but not the obligation to buy a stock  bond  commodity or other instrument at a specified price within a specific time period  On the other hand  Put Option is an option contract giving the owner the right but not the obligation to sell a specified amount of an underlying security at a specified price within a specified time  With this  Essar will exit completely from the joint venture  which is offering nationwide mobile services in India  Vodafone has over   million subscribers and is the third largest operator in India  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  Vodafone also said that final settlement is anticipated to be completed by November     Sources in the know said that the completion of deal would be subject to meeting certain conditions which include Reserve Bank of India\'s permission as well as valuation of the deal  The final shareholding pattern post this deal was not provided by the company as it was not clear whether Vodafone\'s stake would exceed the   per cent FDI limit  Vodafone had entered Indian market in   when it bought Hutchison\'s stake in the joint venture for over USD   billion and after that it had entered into an agreement with Essar for a call and put option for its stake  The two firms were locked in battle over Essar\'s plan to list a firm that had part stake in the joint venture to find out market value of its   per cent stake  The move was opposed by Vodafone saying this may not give true value of Vodafone\'s stake  It had approached the market regulator SEBI and also filed a petition in the Madras High Court  Page   of   ©   Factiva  Inc  All rights reserved  VOLTAS TO EXIT SERMO-PM VENTURE FULLY (Voltas no longer In [12]:
import spacy
In [13]:
nlp=spacy.load("en_core_web_sm")
In [14]:
doc=nlp(z)
In [19]:
text_no_namedentities = []

#removing named entities like name of companies,People's names,Organization name ,etc
ents = [e.text for e in doc.ents]
for item in doc:
    if item.text in ents:
        pass
    else:
        text_no_namedentities.append(item.text)
pre=(" ".join(text_no_namedentities))


pre

Standard BSTN    ( c )    Business Standard Ltd   Capital will acquire AMP Sanmar Life Insurance for    crore   Since the - based life insurance entity has net free assets of   -   crore   Cap will pay a premium of   -   crore   Net free assets essentially denote the book value of an insurance company   calculated after deducting losses from its share capital   AMP Sanmar has a capital base of      crore   The non - banking finance arm of the Anil Dhirubhai Ambani Enterprise ( ) had initially decided to acquire AMP Sanmar through Life Insurance   But it was not possible as Life Insurance was not a legal entity since it did not have a licence from the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority ( IRDA )   IRDA Chairman CS Rao told Business Standard since Life Insurance was not a legal entity   it could not acquire AMP Sanmar   " It is important for to identify the acquirer as the next step will be the due diligence exercise to be undertaken by the insurance regulator " he added   Declining to comment on the actual value of the deal   Graham Meyer   AMP Sanmar CEO   said it had not been a distress sale     Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights reserved   BANKING FINANCE AMP refining and petrochemical complexes at Mangalore and   respectively   Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights reserved   Food to buy out dairy partner    words       The Economic ECTIM ( c )    The of Group   All rights reserved   BANGALORE : Nusli Wadia - controlled Industries has agreed to buy out New Zealand \'s from an existing dairy joint venture   New Zealand Foods   Both and   of the world \'s biggest milk co - operatives   agreed to call off the   :     with the acquirer assuming the cumulative losses and the exiting foreign partner writing down the investments made into venture   The deal will bolster and unlock further synergies in \'s go - to - market strategy   The company in recent months brought biscuits   cakes & rusks and dairy products like cheese   butter   ghee and dairy whitener under distribution vertical   while the \' daily fresh \' products   such as bread and dahi fall into another   The company \'s distribution was fragmented till some time back   with all the business units approaching the trade separately   The mainstay biscuits   non - biscuit bakery ( breads   cakes & rusks ) and dairy constitute strategic business units within the      crore company   " We have a single go - to - market strategy for as far as possible   which is helping us   especially with the modern trade   The distribution has been streamlined into verticals   with the fresh consumption products like bread and curd forming and remaining products going to the market under a separate vertical " Industries Vinita Bali told ET   In fact   has tweaked its brand strategy to accommodate the fresh consumption products under a newly - scripted Daily Fresh umbrella   Ms Bali said the dairy was reporting a turnover of    crore and an annualized growth of   -    The   which had turned profitable in recent   has accumulated losses of around    crore   " We will be taking over the P L of the and so the losses " she added     a significant supplier of milk ingredients to global food giants such as and   wanted to exit the market since it could not deliver much value addition   given the fragmented nature of \'s dairy industry   is known for managing large dairy farms   It is not a big player in the branded dairy sector even though it has milk powder offering under brand in several south east markets   will ramp up its presence in the dairy space through new product offerings post acquisition of the stake   " We will be looking at differentiated SKUs where we can innovate on the basic dairy technology   Take our cheese offering   for instance   where we have a market share of nearly     We came out with slim cheese ( with     lower fat ) as well as cheese cubes and spreads that are clearly differentiated " Ms Bali said   The - exited the liquid milk market in    in wake of mounting losses and has no plans of re - looking at the segment   " It is a high volume low margin play that does not fit into our business model in dairy " she explained   suggesting that \'s dairy play will essentially revolve around milk derivatives   Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights reserved   Buys British Telecom \'s     Stake In Frontline Charmi Gutka    words mutual fund joint venture in the country with Financial   ( ) because of a proposed regulatory change   a person with direct knowledge of the matter said   " The move is prompted by a proposed regulatory change   which makes it mandatory for a company to have of experience before selling mutual funds " the person   who did n\'t wish to be named   told Dow Jones Newswires   The move is also in line with the New - based company \'s strategy to focus on real estate development   the person added   currently owns     in the joint venture -- Pramerica Asset Managers Pvt   Ltd --while owns the remaining     " will sell its     stake to " the person said   without disclosing details of the likely valuation of \'s stake in the venture   Spokespeople from were n\'t immediately available for comment   The person said also that the time frame for \'s exit from the joint venture is yet to be decided   In     and had received an approval from the markets regulator   the Securities & Exchange Board of   to jointly sell mutual funds and said they will jointly invest     in Pramerica   Pramerica was planning to start selling mutual funds in     Earlier   The Economic newspaper reported that plans to exit the venture to reduce its debt of nearly     has been exiting its non - core businesses as part of its strategy to focus more on property development   The company \'s founders recently sold its multiplex - chain   DT Cinemas   to multiplex operator PVR Ltd   The real estate developer also previously announced plans to sell its wind power business   Still   has a separate life insurance venture with   Pramerica Life Insurance Co   Ltd   in which the realty firm owns a majority     stake   while the remaining stake is held by the U S -based insurance company comparison   retailer   which sells prams   pushchairs   car seats   baby clothes and also maternity clothes   entered in    and already has    stores in the country   It will add    more stores this   has    stores and will add another stores in the next -   The luxury market in is bogged down with issues such as high import duties and lack of skilled manpower and quality real estate   There is only luxury mall in the country currently   the Emporio in   and brands are reluctant to enter high street locations due to poor infrastructure around them   The cost of retail real estate is very high and that has been nibbling into the profits of luxury retailers in the country     it costs   -   crore to set up a luxury store while a store for a premium brand can be made for   -   lakh   To offset this cost   some luxury brands have resorted to reducing the size of their stores to improve the sales per sq ft of space   Brands currently operates    stores for its brands and hopes to take HERSHEY   Pa --(BUSINESS WIRE)--September      -- The ( " " ) ( : ) announced that it has reached an agreement to acquire the    percent stake in Ltd   that it does not own   primarily from Industries Ltd   ( " " ) and another minority shareholder   Including the assumption of about       in debt   which is already consolidated by as the majority shareholder   the company will own the Maha Lacto and candy brands and the and beverage brands as well as the related manufacturing facilities   The transaction is expected to close by the end of the quarter and the new entity will transition to use the name as it becomes a wholly owned subsidiary of The   As part of the transaction   the minority shareholders will receive an undisclosed cash consideration   " is a key focus market for The " said J P     President and Chief Executive Officer   The   " We have a great deal of respect for   Our partnership provided us with insights and an understanding of the consumers and customers in   and beverage category growth in is solid and we \'re excited about our opportunities   We \'ll make the necessary investments in to accelerate growth   leveraging our core strengths and business model " The transaction gives an opportunity to integrate into the company \'s global business platform and leverage corporate resources across the chocolate and sweets and refreshment strategic business units   Over time   \'s goal is to evolve into a faster growing market leader in the food and beverage space   " With this new phase of the business in   we aim to drive growth in this important market through product innovation   brand building and investment in our people and processes " said Matthew   Managing Director     " Leveraging the learnings from our partnership and the strong management team in place   we are excited to move forward in this rapidly growing market " concluded   For the ended        the joint venture had net sales of about       The portion of the net loss for the full attributable to was approximately       When the joint venture was announced in     net sales were about       As a result of this transaction there is no change to the financial outlook ago   insurance law caps an overseas partner ’s stake in an insurance venture at     which restricts the amount of equity a foreign partner can put into a business that is highly capital - intensive BUSINESS & ECONOMY   to go their separate ways Nandini Goswami    words       DNA - Daily News & Analysis DNADAI Copyright     Diligent Media Corporation Ltd   partner will buy out major \'s     stake in the It \'s almost official   and   financial giants in their own right who had joined hands for a general insurance venture in the country   are parting ways   has agreed to buy out the     stake held by the foreign partner in the joint venture General Insurance and has applied to the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority ( IRDA ) for requisite approvals   an official told DNA Money on   The company will continue as till a name change comes about   for which it has to apply to the Registrar of Companies   will now hold     in the venture   though it is open to a     foreign equity participation once it finds an appropriate foreign partner   The currently has an equity base of    crore   " All employees will continue to be a part of the same company   where will have the entire stake and we will chose someone to head the company once all this is through " the official said   in the over - relationship have grown since last because of differing risk appetites of the partners     given its size and distribution strength   was keen to move fast   However   had an overcautious approach   particularly on commercial insurance   which was proving to be a drag on the company   the official said   While all general insurance companies have grown their business   General reported a decline in business by       for   -    Its total business premium was      crore   of the lowest in the general insurance industry   Its counterparts and even later entrants have marched way ahead   even as the public sector companies with a large base have also grown at higher rates   Also   the dynamics of the      crore general insurance industry has changed since the detariff regime kicked off in this and there was a crying need for a cohesive management structure to fight it out in the fiercely competitive market place   A formal split was thus waiting to happen   On the kind of signals the split sends out   the official said   " In fact   investors should be happy as there was a genuine concern for the company \'s falling numbers and now there is a concerted effort to grow the company   has a different way of functioning   and given the fact that all our other companies   like life insurance   asset management   bank and the   are doing so well   there should not be any misconception on the break - up   which has been mutually agreed upon " the official added   So   what happens to now   Sources indicated that the global insurance giant is unlikely to discontinue insurance business in   More so   as insurance analysts say   it would be a costly proposition to leave at this juncture   at a time when the economy is booming   and re - entering later may see it lose to straightaway   Market grapevine has it that is also scouting around for partners   This time   though   it may find some comfort with a clutch of investors instead of single company   possibly including some high net - worth Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights in ” officials declined to comment on the development   In     the joint venture company had built its factory for injection moulding machines   Three later   it built a factory in that doubled its production capacity to a machines a   Heavy Industries inherited the    per cent stake in the operation when it bought in     However   for more that      has had a technical collaboration with another injection machinery maker   Windsor Machines in   had started manufacturing injection moulding machines in    in association with Plastics Group   But the formed the   :   joint venture company only after   Soon after   the venture had emerged as the leading injection moulding solutions provider in   launched a petition last to the government in which it accused rivals of dumping for the development   manufacture and marketing of tuberculosis ( ) drugs   The companies had agreed to a   -   joint global marketing agreement   Though the companies have discontinued that agreement opportunities in the malaria market   is the largest generic drugmaker in the Southern Hemisphere and of the top    generic manufacturers worldwide   according to the company   It is also \'s largest pharmaceutical company   Release date : Jan        Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights reserved   Emerging Business & IT Drugs buys out \'s stake in    words       The Economic ECTIM ( c )    The of Group   All rights reserved   HYDERABAD : - based Drugs   makers of the capsules   has bought out the stake of - based Labs in the joint venture Healthcare for a consideration of      crore   After gaining control of Healthcare   the company is busy drawing up a turnaround plan that includes fresh investments for improving sales margins and addition of new molecules in cardiology and antibiotics   expects the buyout of the partner \'s stake in will give them the much - needed stability and foothold in the domestic market   With its expanded basket   including formulations in antibiotics   pain management and anti- asthmatic   is expecting to reduce its dependency on APIs considerably   " Most of our turnover comes from export of APIs   where price volatility is high   By attaining full ownership of Healthcare   we will be able to focus on marketing formulations in domestic market   This will help us to circumvent the volatility   making our bottomline stronger " Drugs director ( marketing )   Srinivas   told ET   The company is likely to undertake a management restructuring as part of the turnaround   For the erstwhile joint venture   Drugs is looking to achieve a turnover of    crore in against the present    crore   " We found it difficult to chalk out marketing strategies within the confinement of a   Now we can focus on achieving sales volumes for the existing products   It will take   -   months for the new molecules to attain critical mass " Mr said   However   the company refused to make any comments on management restructuring   " The valuation process is on   It will take at least month for us to finalise investments and other changes " he said   Healthcare was a   :   joint venture between - based Labs and   It was floated to market \'s products in the domestic market   Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights reserved   & ends   -year defence with Systems Distributed by com    words       Domain - B ATDOMB Copyright ©     The Information Pvt   Ltd   & ( ) said that its subsidiary Defence Systems will acquire Systems \'   -per cent stake in their defence joint venture   Defence Land Systems ( )   ending a - partnership with \'s biggest aerospace company   The move comes just a after the - based company appointed Dean McCumiskey as managing director and chief executive of its operations in place of Andrew Gallagher in order to lead the next phase of Systems \' business development in the country   ( See : Dean McCumiskey to head Systems in ( http : www domain - b com people in_the_news   _ bae_systems html ) ) " This decision is a reflection of the shareholders \' belief that they can best meet emerging customer requirements and address the opportunities in this dynamic market with a flexible   tailored approach that was not easily facilitated by the structure of the existing joint - venture entity " both companies said in a joint statement   The companies had set up the in    to develop new technologies and the manufacture of trusted armoured vehicles like the Axe   Rakshak     up - armoured and bulletproof and   and Rapid Intervention Vehicles   ( See :   Systems set up defence for land systems ( http : www domain - b com companies companies_m   _ mahindra_group_oneView html ) ) At present   produces combat vehicles such as Rakshak   Rakshak Plus   and MPVi   armoured bus   riot intervention vehicle and Uparmoured for VIP security   The company \'s plant has a capacity to produce up to    vehicles a   of which up to    are - Is   In the last to the company has invested about   crore on the plant   Commenting on the development   Brigadier ( Retd ) Khutub Hai   chairman and of Defence Systems   " This is a strategic decision and will enable both the companies to approach opportunities individually and to offer customised solutions to meet the needs of the defence land systems domain " Dean McCumiskey said   " Building domestic capabilities in partnership with companies will remain a cornerstone of our strategy in   We look forward to opportunities to collaborate with and others to enhance the role of the private sector in the defence industry " also has a with - based Telephonics Corp to make radar systems and another with - based Arabia Holdings and Ras Al Khaimah Transport Investments to develop armored vehicles for the Middle East   Central and market   also has a software engineering joint venture in called BAeHA with Aeronautics Limited ( )   Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights reserved   to acquire \'s stake in Distributed by com latter \'s equity in their JVs   Automotives Ltd ( ) and Engines Pvt Ltd ( )   Following the purchase   both and would become wholly - owned subsidiaries of   would take complete ownership of operations and continue to sell and products albeit under its own brand name   The sale requires regulatory approval in   is subject to the conclusion of definitive agreements   and is expected to be completed in early     The terms of the proposed transaction call for to pay approximately    crores or      for group \'s stake in both ventures   The payout will happen in parts   While     percent will be paid out as and when the deal goes through ( upon the receipt of regulatory approvals )   the remainder will be payable from the date of the payment   The agreement allows to continue sourcing components from while would continue to provide engineering services to   Group would continue to support through a license agreement and extend necessary support to and for the purposes of business continuity     the agreement covers the localised      litre engine   \' Under the terms of our agreement   we can use the engine for as long as needed for business continuity   The engine may be deployed for the domestic market as well as export operations \' explains Dr     President and Farm Equipment Sector   But   the engine is not exclusive to ; can still commercially exploit it reserved   Ashok Leyland completes acquisition of JVs with Anil    words       IHS Global Insight Daily Analysis WDAN Copyright     IHS Global Insight Limited   All Rights Reserved   Ashok Leyland has completed the acquisition of joint ventures ( JVs ) with   the company said in a statement   The JVs in question are Ashok Leyland Vehicles Ltd ( ALNVL ) for vehicle manufacturing ; Ashok Leyland Power Train Ltd ( ) for making powertrains ; and Ashok Leyland Technologies Ltd ( )   a technology   All the JVs operate in the light commercial vehicle ( ) space   As part of the agreement reached between Ashok Leyland and   the latter transferred its shareholding in the ventures to the former for a consolidated consideration of   (    )   Ashok Leyland will continue to build the Dost   Partner   and LCVs   while servicing and parts availability for customers will be taken care of by a technical support team   Significance : The completion of the transaction is on expected lines as the competition watchdog in had already cleared the deal agreed between the partners ( see :      : )   The companies signed the JVs in    in an effort to gain a foothold in \'s light and medium commercial vehicle market   However   the partnership did not go as planned with delays in product launches   declining sales   widening losses   and write - offs   Except for the Dost   the venture did not have any commercial success and the slower introduction of additional variants further contributed to the losses   Early this   the differences between the partners came out into the public domain and subsequent development resulted in an exchange of legal notices to each other before both the parties decided to call off the partnership in ( see – :      : )   Page    of    ©    Factiva being produced in the facility to other areas such as driveline and chassis components   in which is a market leader " a spokesperson said   The company   which is also present in various other Pulse Pty Limited   New         ( ) -- \'s largest lender State Bank of ( ) said it has cancelled a proposed merchant acquiring business joint venture with - based Incorporation and International   The bank has cancelled the negotiations for establishing a joint venture entity with and for conducting the merchant acquiring business   informed the   The merchant acquiring business involves facilitation of payments through debit or credit cards at retail outlets   The had already approved the setting up of a wholly owned subsidiary by in the name of Payment Services for conducting the merchant acquiring business   The proposed joint venture between Payment Services Pvt Ltd ( a wholly owned subsidiary of )   and was mooted in     it said   In     the bank had floated a Request For Proposal ( ) for selection of joint venture ( ) partners for the merchant acquiring business   The business was to include acquisition of bank identification numbers ( BINs ) and providing managed services for point - of - sale ( PoS ) terminals   The managed services would have included deployment of terminals at customer locations   their replacement   merchant training and maintenance   among others   State Bank of Group presently has over      ATMs across the country and has issued over    debit cards   DP ARV ARV    Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights reserved   exits from terminating the joint venture agreement being executed from      in relation to Tata MetaliksKubota Pipes   subsidiary of the company " Tata Metaliks said to the   SEVERE COMPETITION   in which the partners had invested around    crore   was affected by severe price competition in ductile iron ( DI ) pipes and was upstaged by intense price cutting by regional players in the last to   Hit by low net realisations in an industry facing overcapacity   especially in the eastern region   \'s margins suffered " At point   price of pig iron and DI pipes were at the same level   There was no premium on value addition which is absurd   The DI pipe market is essentially led by projects   There is no concept of marketshare   The situation worsened till it became economically unsustainable for a lot of companies that were operating at very low capacity " said an industry analyst   MINING CRISIS Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights reserved   Tata Metaliks \' main business   too   has been )    Kasturi & Sons Ltd BUSINESS The are close to buying back NTT ’s      per cent stake in Tata Teleservices Ltd ( TTSL ) at an earlier agreed upon price of      crore as the Reserve Bank of ( ) is understood to have relaxed its fair value pricing norm as a special case to enable them to honour their commitment made to the company   The easing of norms comes following enhanced business ties between and   The ’s fair value pricing norm does not allow companies to buy back shares at more price than the fair market value   and this is why the Tata- NTT deal could not be completed despite several notices from NTT and even the company initiating arbitration proceedings against Tata Sons and TTSL in to recover its money   “ Tata Sons has made the necessary application to the Reserve Bank of   The company is awaiting a response ” a Tata Sons spokesperson said while responding to queries   In      NTT had invested       in TTSL to pick up      per cent stake   The shareholder ’s agreement had guaranteed it at least    per cent of the investment if it wished to exit in case of TTSL failing to meet certain performance targets   Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights reserved Putting an end to the corporate battle   - based announced it would exercise the option to acquire its partner \'s    per cent stake which will result in payment of   With this   may have to look for another domestic partner to remain compliant with the FDI norms in the telecom sector of a maximum stake of    per cent   " Group announces that the Group has exercised its underwritten put option over    per cent of Limited ( VEL )   " Following the exercise by the Group of its put option   has exercised its call option over the remaining    per cent of VEL owned by the Group   resulting in a total cash payment of    " said in a statement   Call Option allows an investor the right but not the obligation to buy a stock   bond   commodity or other instrument at a specified price within a specific time period   On the other hand   Put Option is an option contract giving the owner the right but not the obligation to sell a specified amount of an underlying security at a specified price within a specified time   With this   will exit completely from the joint venture   which is offering nationwide mobile services in   has over    subscribers and is the largest operator in   Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights reserved   also said that final settlement is anticipated to be completed by      Sources in the know said that the completion of deal would be subject to meeting certain conditions which include Reserve Bank of \'s permission as well as valuation of the deal   The final shareholding pattern post this deal was not provided by the company as it was not clear whether \'s stake would exceed the    per cent FDI limit   had entered market in    when it bought \'s stake in the joint venture for over    and after that it had entered into an agreement with for a call and put option for its stake   The firms were locked in battle over \'s plan to list a firm that had part stake in the joint venture to find out market value of its    per cent stake   The move was opposed by saying this may not give true value of \'s stake   It had approached the market regulator and also filed a petition in the Madras High Court   Page    of    ©    Factiva     All rights import pandas as pd
# removing some words not recognized as entities bu 

removewords = ['factiva','srivats','singh','AMP Sanmar','titagarh','bj','venugopal', 'rajagopal','aroq','giorgio','wsj','ntt','ruchi','giorgio','biswajit','mohan','frigo',
              'elizabeth', 'shankar','bn','wal','prizm','lombard','gulati','sca','vide','usa','nikhil','tamil','ttsl','dplm','khaimah',
             'pramerica','hai','apollo','bombay','foray','delhi','mccumiskey','www','nayantara', 'mpvi', 'irda','fipb','nippon','mr','hersun','rajagopal',
              'tata','croda','kim','eagleeye','htsyndication','sl','sjk','aman','nihon','beteiligungsgesellschaft','airtel','sagar', 'eagle','av','ve',
              'di','ashok','charmi','htaccf','said','dr','vijaya','chemiphar','ambani','ft','sermo','efs','mittal','piyush','rico','murugappa',
              'sanmar','htsyndication','jcn','ramanathan','ht','jasper','mckinsey','york','jasper','divya','druva','cholamandalam','dpin','sankyo','shravan',
              'johns','bhandari','ve','vcc','deloite','rancher','lacto','jones','bali','coleman','changapally','kit','fy','anil','arm','cap','non','bstn','did','page']
querywords = pre.split()

resultwords  = [word for word in querywords if word.lower() not in removewords]
result = ' '.join(resultwords)


#splitting text file into 3 parts so that max_df and min_df work and very high and low frequency words are removed
data = {'col':[result[:500]]}      
  
# Create DataFrame 
df = pd.DataFrame(data) 
  
# Print the output.
df['col'][1]=result[500:1000]
df['col'][2]=result[1000:]









#print(result)

#df = pd.DataFrame(data)

In [49]:
from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import TfidfVectorizer
In [50]:
tfidf=TfidfVectorizer(max_df=0.9,min_df=2,stop_words='english')
In [51]:
from sklearn.decomposition import NMF
In [73]:
dtm=tfidf.fit_transform(df['col'])
model=NMF(n_components=12,random_state=42)
In [ ]:
In [74]:
model.fit(dtm)
model.components_.shape
Out[74]:
(12, 36)
In [75]:
fir=model.components_[0]
fir10=fir.argsort()[-15:]
for i in fir10:
    print(tfidf.get_feature_names()[i])  #checking first topic

authority
told
enterprise
licence
important
initially
step
chairman
development
regulatory
possible
exercise
acquirer
decided
legal
In [ ]:
In [76]:
for index, topic in enumerate(model.components_):
    print(f"The top 15 words for topic {index}")
    print([tfidf.get_feature_names()[i] for i in topic.argsort()[-15:]])
